00028 #include <string.h>
00029 
00030 #include "MEM_guardedalloc.h"
00031 #include "BLI_utildefines.h"
00032 
00033 #include "BLI_smallhash.h"
00034 
00035 /* SMHASH_CELL_UNUSED means this cell is inside a key series,
00036  * while SMHASH_CELL_FREE means this cell terminates a key series.
00037  *
00038  * no chance of anyone shoving INT32_MAX-2 into a *val pointer, I
00039  * imagine.  hopefully.
00040  *
00041  * note: these have the SMHASH suffix because we may want to make them public.
00042  */
00043 #define SMHASH_CELL_UNUSED  ((void *)0x7FFFFFFF)
00044 #define SMHASH_CELL_FREE    ((void *)0x7FFFFFFD)
00045 
00046 #define SMHASH_NONZERO(n) ((n) + !(n))
00047 #define SMHASH_NEXT(h, hoff) ABS(((h) + ((hoff = SMHASH_NONZERO(hoff * 2) + 1), hoff)))
00048 
00049 extern unsigned int hashsizes[];
00050 
00051 void BLI_smallhash_init(SmallHash *hash)
00052 {
00053     int i;
00054 
00055     memset(hash, 0, sizeof(*hash));
00056 
00057     hash->table = hash->_stacktable;
00058     hash->curhash = 2;
00059     hash->size = hashsizes[hash->curhash];
00060 
00061     hash->copytable = hash->_copytable;
00062     hash->stacktable = hash->_stacktable;
00063 
00064     for (i = 0; i < hash->size; i++) {
00065         hash->table[i].val = SMHASH_CELL_FREE;
00066     }
00067 }
00068 
00069 /*NOTE: does *not* free *hash itself!  only the direct data!*/
00070 void BLI_smallhash_release(SmallHash *hash)
00071 {
00072     if (hash == NULL) {
00073         return;
00074     }
00075 
00076     if (hash->table != hash->stacktable) {
00077         MEM_freeN(hash->table);
00078     }
00079 }
00080 
00081 void BLI_smallhash_insert(SmallHash *hash, uintptr_t key, void *item)
00082 {
00083     int h, hoff=1;
00084 
00085     if (hash->size < hash->used * 3) {
00086         int newsize = hashsizes[++hash->curhash];
00087         SmallHashEntry *tmp;
00088         int i = 0;
00089 
00090         if (hash->table != hash->stacktable || newsize > SMSTACKSIZE) {
00091             tmp = MEM_callocN(sizeof(*hash->table) * newsize, __func__);
00092         }
00093         else {
00094             SWAP(SmallHashEntry *, hash->stacktable, hash->copytable);
00095             tmp = hash->stacktable;
00096         }
00097 
00098         SWAP(SmallHashEntry *, tmp, hash->table);
00099 
00100         hash->size = newsize;
00101 
00102         for (i = 0; i < hash->size; i++) {
00103             hash->table[i].val = SMHASH_CELL_FREE;
00104         }
00105 
00106         for (i = 0; i<hashsizes[hash->curhash - 1]; i++) {
00107             if (ELEM(tmp[i].val, SMHASH_CELL_UNUSED, SMHASH_CELL_FREE)) {
00108                 continue;
00109             }
00110 
00111             h = ABS((int)(tmp[i].key));
00112             hoff = 1;
00113             while (!ELEM(hash->table[h % newsize].val, SMHASH_CELL_UNUSED, SMHASH_CELL_FREE)) {
00114                 h = SMHASH_NEXT(h, hoff);
00115             }
00116 
00117             h %= newsize;
00118 
00119             hash->table[h].key = tmp[i].key;
00120             hash->table[h].val = tmp[i].val;
00121         }
00122 
00123         if (tmp != hash->stacktable && tmp != hash->copytable) {
00124             MEM_freeN(tmp);
00125         }
00126     }
00127 
00128     h = ABS((int)key);
00129     hoff = 1;
00130 
00131     while (!ELEM(hash->table[h % hash->size].val, SMHASH_CELL_UNUSED, SMHASH_CELL_FREE)) {
00132         h = SMHASH_NEXT(h, hoff);
00133     }
00134 
00135     h %= hash->size;
00136     hash->table[h].key = key;
00137     hash->table[h].val = item;
00138 
00139     hash->used++;
00140 }
00141 
00142 void BLI_smallhash_remove(SmallHash *hash, uintptr_t key)
00143 {
00144     int h, hoff=1;
00145 
00146     h = ABS((int)key);
00147 
00148     while ((hash->table[h % hash->size].key != key) ||
00149            (hash->table[h % hash->size].val == SMHASH_CELL_UNUSED))
00150     {
00151         if (hash->table[h % hash->size].val == SMHASH_CELL_FREE) {
00152             return;
00153         }
00154 
00155         h = SMHASH_NEXT(h, hoff);
00156     }
00157 
00158     h %= hash->size;
00159     hash->table[h].key = 0;
00160     hash->table[h].val = SMHASH_CELL_UNUSED;
00161 }
00162 
00163 void *BLI_smallhash_lookup(SmallHash *hash, uintptr_t key)
00164 {
00165     int h, hoff=1;
00166     void *v;
00167 
00168     h = ABS((int)key);
00169 
00170     if (hash->table == NULL) {
00171         return NULL;
00172     }
00173 
00174     while ((hash->table[h % hash->size].key != key) ||
00175            (hash->table[h % hash->size].val == SMHASH_CELL_UNUSED))
00176     {
00177         if (hash->table[h % hash->size].val == SMHASH_CELL_FREE) {
00178             return NULL;
00179         }
00180 
00181         h = SMHASH_NEXT(h, hoff);
00182     }
00183 
00184     v = hash->table[h % hash->size].val;
00185     if (ELEM(v, SMHASH_CELL_UNUSED, SMHASH_CELL_FREE)) {
00186         return NULL;
00187     }
00188 
00189     return v;
00190 }
00191 
00192 
00193 int BLI_smallhash_haskey(SmallHash *hash, uintptr_t key)
00194 {
00195     int h = ABS((int)key);
00196     int hoff =1;
00197 
00198     if (hash->table == NULL) {
00199         return 0;
00200     }
00201 
00202     while ((hash->table[h % hash->size].key != key) ||
00203            (hash->table[h % hash->size].val == SMHASH_CELL_UNUSED))
00204     {
00205         if (hash->table[h % hash->size].val == SMHASH_CELL_FREE) {
00206             return 0;
00207         }
00208 
00209         h = SMHASH_NEXT(h, hoff);
00210     }
00211 
00212     return !ELEM(hash->table[h % hash->size].val, SMHASH_CELL_UNUSED, SMHASH_CELL_FREE);
00213 }
00214 
00215 int BLI_smallhash_count(SmallHash *hash)
00216 {
00217     return hash->used;
00218 }
00219 
00220 void *BLI_smallhash_iternext(SmallHashIter *iter, uintptr_t *key)
00221 {
00222     while (iter->i < iter->hash->size) {
00223         if (    (iter->hash->table[iter->i].val != SMHASH_CELL_UNUSED) &&
00224                 (iter->hash->table[iter->i].val != SMHASH_CELL_FREE))
00225         {
00226             if (key) {
00227                 *key = iter->hash->table[iter->i].key;
00228             }
00229 
00230             iter->i++;
00231 
00232             return iter->hash->table[iter->i - 1].val;
00233         }
00234 
00235         iter->i++;
00236     }
00237 
00238     return NULL;
00239 }
00240 
00241 void *BLI_smallhash_iternew(SmallHash *hash, SmallHashIter *iter, uintptr_t *key)
00242 {
00243     iter->hash = hash;
00244     iter->i = 0;
00245 
00246     return BLI_smallhash_iternext(iter, key);
00247 }

00253 {
00254     int i, linecol=79, c=0;
00255 
00256     printf("{");
00257     for (i=0; i<hash->size; i++) {
00258         if (hash->table[i].val == SMHASH_CELL_UNUSED) {
00259             printf("--u-");
00260         }

00262             printf("--f-");
00263         }
00264         else    {
00265             printf("%2x", (unsigned int)hash->table[i].key);
00266         }
00267 
00268         if (i != hash->size-1)
00269             printf(", ");
00270 
00271         c += 6;
00272 
00273         if (c >= linecol) {
00274             printf("\n ");
00275             c = 0;
00276         }
00277     }
00278 
00279     fflush(stdout);
00280 }
